body_html:
@lantiga: debug annotations are still a good idea and we should continue to pursue that direction by adding annotations to the trace. I just don't want to make guarantees in the API about what the final names will be. For instance, it should be ok if you tell the trace to add a debug name "foo" that it actually names the node "foo.1" because it needed to for some reason. It should also be fine for it to delete the node in an optimization.

This patch was really only focused on providing input/output names for use in Caffe2, and not the general debugging problem.

body:
@lantiga: debug annotations are still a good idea and we should continue to pursue that direction by adding annotations to the trace. I just don't want to make guarantees in the API about what the final names will be. For instance, it should be ok if you tell the trace to add a debug name "foo" that it actually names the node "foo.1" because it needed to for some reason. It should also be fine for it to delete the node in an optimization. 

This patch was really only focused on providing input/output names for use in Caffe2, and not the general debugging problem.
